name: Sudden increase in the number of session
description:
This rule checks for a sudden increase in the number of sessions.
This rule is powered by a generic sudden drop/increase detector which is based on a modified version of the E-Divisive with Medians (EDM) algorithm for detection of changes in distribution of values of a given metric over the time.

fields.name: content
fields.value:
1. Check your application logs and server metrics to identify any unusual patterns or spikes in the number of sessions.
2. If you find any suspicious activity, investigate the root cause, such as code changes, configuration issues, or third-party integrations.
3. Once you have identified the cause, take appropriate action to address it, such as rolling back code changes, fixing configuration errors, or disabling problematic third-party integrations.
4. After addressing the issue, monitor your application logs and server metrics to ensure that the number of sessions returns to normal levels.
